metadata.title: CVE-2024-26642 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: disallow anonymous set with timeout flag Anonymoussets are never used with timeout from userspace, reject this. Exception tothis rule is NFT_SET_EVAL to ensure legacy meters still work.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-256-generic - 4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-256-generic - 4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-256-lowlatency - 4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1133-aws - 4.4.0-1133.139
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1178-azure - 4.15.0-1178.193~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.139').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1178.193~14.04.1').
